intro: Orthosiphon atacorensis, commonly known as the Brazilian horse chestnut, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that bloom in summer. It is often grown for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for gardens in temperate climates.
